comments.body: This was so easy to make. I love olive oil and it is so tasty. I took your advice and made a sandwich with Mozzarella and I used sour dough bread. I grilled it in the pan and topped it off with Classico sauce!
Enjoyed this classic recipe thanks for sharing!
Taste so good on a hot summer night!

recipes.title: Fried Egg Plant
recipes.ingredients:
One Large Egg Plant
2 Eggs
Italian Style Bread Crumbs
Olive Oil
recipes.directions:
Slice eggplant from top to bottom (on its side).
Cut about 1/8 in thickness.
Heat frying pan on medium.
Pour in about a tablespoon or more of olive oil to cover pan. Wisk two eggs in bowl.
Sprinkle bread crumbs on plate.
Dip each sliced eggplant into egg batter and cover with bread crumbs on each side.
Fill frying plan with battered egg plant slices.
Flip eggplant when golden brown.
Let cool on plate with paper towel to absorb excess oil.
Enjoy solo or with a main meal.

recipes.title: Pan Fried Blackened Cajun Catfish
recipes.ingredients:
Two Catfish Fillets
Cajun Spice
One Egg
Bread Crumbs
Butter
recipes.directions:
Wisk egg and dip fillet so egg batter covers entire fish
Cover with bread crumbs both sides.
Shake cajun spice over fillet on both sides.
Melt butter in fying pan medium/high heat.
Make sure pan is hot and add fillets.
Cook on each side for a few minutes.
Test with fork to make sure fish flakes before serving.

recipes.title: Gazpacho
recipes.ingredients:
1 1/2 pounds vine-ripened tomatoes, peeled, seeded and chopped
Tomato juice
1 cup cucumber, peeled, seeded and chopped
1/2 cup chopped red bell pepper
1 medium garlic clove, minced
1 small jalapeno, seeded and minced
1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
1 lime, juiced
2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar
2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce
1/2 teaspoon toasted, ground cumin
1 teaspoon kosher salt
1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons fresh basil leaves, chiffonade
recipes.directions:
Fill a 6-quart pot halfway full of water, set over high heat and bring to a boil.
Make an X with a paring knife on the bottom of the tomatoes
Drop the tomatoes into the boiling water for 15 seconds
 remove and transfer to an ice bath and allow to cool until able to handle, approximately 1 minute.
Remove and pat dry.
 Peel, core and seed the tomatoes.
When seeding the tomatoes, place the seeds and pulp into a fine mesh strainer set over a bowl in order to catch the juice.
Press as much of the juice through as possible and then add enough bottled tomato juice to bring the total to 1 cup
Place the tomatoes and juice into a large mixing bowl
Add the cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, jalapeno, garlic clove, olive oil, lime juice, balsamic vinegar Worcestershire, cumin, salt and pepper and stir to combine.
Transfer 1 1/2 cups of the mixture to a blender and puree for 15 to 20 seconds on high speed.
Return the pureed mixture to the bowl and stir to combine.
Cover and chill for 2 hours and up to overnight.
Serve with chiffonade of basil.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Jelly Sandwich
recipes.directions:
Smooth Jelly and Peanut Butter on Bread
Wash down with glass of milk

recipes.title: Cheese Sandwich
recipes.directions:
Spread mustard
Put cheese on bread.
Enjoy

recipes.title: Cheese Burger
recipes.ingredients:
Hamburger meat (85% lean)
Hamburger buns
Mustard
Onion
Tomato
Avocado
recipes.directions:
Heat frying pan to medium/high
Cook few minutes each side
Cook to (medium, pink, well done etc.)
Add slice of favorite cheese (let melt)
Cover with lid
Add sliced tomato, onion, avocado
Add condiments (ketchup, mustard, mayo)
Enjoy!

chefs.name: Kurt Hogentogler
chefs.profile: Software engineer by day and chef hobbyist on the weekends. Some of my favorite dishes are fried egg plant, pan fried blackened cajun catfish, and seared tuna. Favorite dessert is carrot cake.

chefs.name: Marina Gomez
chefs.profile: I've been cooking since I was a child. My mother made classic Spanish dishes and I enjoy making those today. They bring back great memories.
